node.title: Changes to Queensland's border rules flagged as $1m stimulus comes into play
node.alt: A car and police at a border checkpoint.
node.description: Motorists may be waved through Queensland's southern border when the state opens up next month. Meanwhile, struggling business owners are cheering a timelyÂ new round of discount vouchers.
node.content:
["Border crossings may drastically change once Queensland\u00a0reopens next month, with the state government revealing it is in talks with police about the possibility of conducting random intercepts from December 17.", "While checkpoints on the southern Gold Coast will remain after the scheduled\u00a0opening date, police may relax the policy\u00a0of\u00a0stopping and checking every vehicle crossing the border regardless of whether the state has reached a\u00a090 per cent double vaccination rate.", "Major changes\u00a0foreshadowed by\u00a0Health Minister Yvette D'Ath on Wednesday could see motorists randomly checked at the border or waved through instead of each car being stopped.", "\"I get there's going to be thousands and thousands of cars going back and forth across the border every single day, once we hit that 80 per cent mark,\" she said.", "\"We want to make sure that\u00a0the cars can flow and we're very mindful of Christmas holidays and everything coming up \u2014 it will be even busier.", "\"So we're working through with police\u00a0how we do that, and whether it's checking every single vehicle, whether it's \u2026 random stops and checks, whether it's just waving people through.", "", "
Yvette D'Ath says the government is working out the finer details with police.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "
'Clear milestones' ahead
", "Today Queensland Minister for Employment and Small Business Di Farmer\u00a0assured border-business owners the government was\u00a0working \"around the clock\" to \"streamline\" the process for border crossing once the state reopens.", "Ms Farmer's comments came as\u00a0she and Destination Gold Coast announced\u00a0$1 million in \"Play Money\" discount vouchers for struggling border businesses.", "\"We have some very clear milestones ahead of us and they're not very far away,\" she said.", "\"We know on the 19th of November \u2013 if we reach 70 per cent vaccination levels \u2013 that restrictions\u00a0will ease, and then on the 17th\u00a0of December, if not beforehand, we will see people being able to come across the border \u2014 basically Queensland will be open to people from other states.\"", "Ms Farmer said she was personally \"advocating very strongly\" to ensure opening up the state did adversely affect border businesses.", "", "
Di Farmer says the government is working hard to help business owners.(ABC Gold Coast:\u00a0Tara Cassidy)
", "
'Red carpet' for Play Money
", "From today, 18,000 Play Money\u00a0discount vouchers will be available for\u00a0redemption in the border zone, which includes Tugun, Currumbin, Currumbin Waters and Coolangatta.", "They can be used at bars and restaurants and for accommodation, retail and other attractions.", "The vouchers are part of a relief package announced in September, which also includes hardship grants for businesses.", "Up to five vouchers can be purchased at a time, and they give the holder discounts of $50 or $100 at their business of choice, depending on the amount spent.", "Destination Gold Coast chief executive Patricia\u00a0O'Callaghan said businesses that signed up\u00a0would be \"rolling out the red carpet\" to anyone who purchased the vouchers.", "", "
Hillary Jacobs says\u00a0businesses are thrilled with the announcement.(ABC Gold Coast: Tara Cassidy)
", "
'Light at the end of the tunnel'
", "Southern Gold Coast Chamber of Commerce president\u00a0Hillary Jacobs conceded some businesses had not been able to survive border closures\u00a0but said the Play Money initiative\u00a0could see the remaining operators make it through until Christmas.", "\"I think we have to face reality that there are businesses out there that are already shut up,\" she said.", "\"It's not something that any of us like to see \u2014 it's a disappointment, but I do think this is an opportunity\u00a0to be able to save some that are going to be able to now make it through to Christmas.\"", "", "
Coolangatta clothing shop owner Philippa King says the lifeline couldn't have come at a better time.(ABC Gold Coast: Tara Cassidy)
", "Philippa King, who has owned\u00a0retail store Olive and Vern at Coolangatta\u00a0for the past seven years, said she had lost 40 per cent of her customers since the Queensland borders had closed.", "\"At the moment we do see light at the end of the tunnel \u2014 people are coming back with amazing support,\" she said.", "\"[The vouchers]\u00a0couldn't have come at a better time for us."]
